results.idea: Short stocks with rising short-term beta vs long-term beta (momentum in sensitivity)
results.description: Combine beta short-term and long-term to capture stocks whose market sensitivity increased recently. SUGGESTION1 applied: used multiple datafields (beta 30d and 90d). SUGGESTION2 not applicable (no vector fields). SUGGESTION3 not needed (coverage >0.75). SUGGESTION4 applied: used high userCount fields (beta_last_30_days_spy and beta_last_90_days_spy have good coverage/userCount). Kept implementation short per KEEP_IN_MINDs. Confidence = 0.65

results.idea: Long stocks with declining short-term beta vs long-term beta (risk reduction)
results.description: Mean-reversion idea: long stocks whose beta fell recently vs long-term. S1: used two beta fields. S2: not applicable. S3: not needed. S4: applied. Respected KEEP_IN_MIND limits. Confidence = 0.62

results.idea: Long low-correlation to SPY recently (diversifier)
results.description: Favor stocks with low 30d correlation to SPY expecting idiosyncratic upside. S1: single-field (but strong signal), S2: none, S3: not needed, S4: correlation_last_30_days_spy has decent userCount. Implementation kept minimal. Confidence = 0.55

results.idea: Short high-correlation to SPY (ride market downturns)
results.description: Short stocks with high 60d correlation to SPY to capture market-driven declines. S1: used one field but chosen for high alphaCount. S2/3 not applicable. S4: applied. KEEP_IN_MIND honored. Confidence = 0.58

results.idea: Long stocks with falling systematic risk (decreasing market-driven volatility)
results.description: Buy stocks whose systematic risk dropped recently (30d vs 90d). S1: used systematic_risk_last_30_days and systematic_risk_last_90_days. S2: none. S3: not needed. S4: fields have respectable userCount. Confidence = 0.60

results.idea: Short stocks with increasing systematic risk (recently more market-sensitive)
results.description: Momentum in systematic risk used to avoid or short risky names. S1: two systematic fields. S2/3 not applicable. S4: applied. Confidence = 0.57

results.idea: Long stocks with high unsystematic risk (idiosyncratic growth potential)
results.description: Target names with high unsystematic_risk_last_60_days expecting stock-specific moves. S1: single field selected for signal strength. S2: no vector. S3: coverage adequate. S4: good userCount. Confidence = 0.50

results.idea: Short stocks with very high unsystematic risk vs peers (overreaction)
results.description: Short names with unusual spikes in unsystematic risk (30d vs 360d). S1: used two unsystematic fields. S2/3 not needed. S4: used high alphaCount unsystematic_360d. Confidence = 0.54

results.idea: Risk-adjusted beta: low beta per unit of systematic risk
results.description: Divide beta by systematic risk to prefer stocks with low sensitivity normalized by market risk. S1: used beta_last_60_days_spy and systematic_risk_last_60_days. S2/3 not applicable. S4: both fields have high userCount. KEEP_IN_MIND obeyed. Confidence = 0.68

results.idea: High beta but low unsystematic risk (efficient leverage)
results.description: Target stocks with high beta but low idiosyncratic noise (beta/unsystematic). S1: two fields. S2/3 not applicable. S4: fields have strong coverage. Confidence = 0.64

results.idea: Momentum in correlation: decreasing correlation signals decoupling
results.description: Long names whose correlation to SPY fell (60d vs 360d), anticipating idiosyncratic moves. S1: correlation_last_60_days_spy and correlation_last_360_days_spy used. S2/3 not applicable. S4: used higher userCount fields. Confidence = 0.56

results.idea: Short names with rising correlation to SPY (becoming market bets)
results.description: Short when short-term correlation exceeds long-term. S1 applied, S2/3 not needed, S4 used. Confidence = 0.57

results.idea: Long low-beta & low-correlation stocks (defensive diversifiers)
results.description: Combine beta and correlation to find defensives: low beta_last_90_days_spy and low correlation_last_90_days_spy. S1: used two fields. S2/3 not applicable. S4: both fields have solid metrics. Confidence = 0.61

results.idea: Short high-beta & high-correlation stocks (aggressive market-takers)
results.description: Combine beta and correlation to short names likely to amplify market moves. S1 applied. S2/3 not used. S4 applied. Confidence = 0.63

results.idea: Mean-revert unsystematic risk normalized by correlation (idiosyncratic vs market linkage)
results.description: Prefer names with high unsystematic risk but low correlation (high stock-specific vol unlinked to market). S1: unsystematic_risk_last_60_days and correlation_last_60_days_spy. S2/3 not relevant. S4: both good userCounts. Confidence = 0.52

results.idea: Short names where unsystematic risk rose but correlation also rose (sector-driven idiosyncrasy)
results.description: If both idiosyncratic risk and correlation increase, could signal mispricing. S1 used two fields. S2/3 not used. S4 applied. Confidence = 0.49

results.idea: Prefer names with stable beta (low beta std): use difference between 360d and 30d betas small
results.description: Stability in beta suggests predictable exposure; long stable names. S1 used beta_last_360_days_spy and beta_last_30_days_spy. S2/3 N/A. S4 applied. Confidence = 0.53

results.idea: Short names with volatile beta (big beta change)
results.description: Target large |beta_30 - beta_360| expecting mispriced exposure. S1 applied. S2/3 not needed. S4 used. Confidence = 0.50

results.idea: Risk parity tilt: long low systematic risk per unit of unsystematic risk
results.description: Prefer stocks where systematic risk is small relative to idiosyncratic (diversification benefit). S1 used systematic_risk_last_60_days and unsystematic_risk_last_60_days. S4 applied. Confidence = 0.59

results.idea: Opportunistic long when unsystematic risk spikes but long-term unsystematic is low (reversion)
results.description: Compare unsystematic 30d vs 360d; spike may revert. S1 used both fields. S2/3 N/A. S4 used high alphaCount 360d. Confidence = 0.51

results.idea: Short-term beta divergence between 30d and 60d (recent acceleration)
results.description: Detect accelerating beta changes and short names where beta increased quickly. S1 used beta_last_30_days_spy and beta_last_60_days_spy. S2/3 N/A. S4 applied. Confidence = 0.56

results.idea: Long names with lower correlation short-term than medium-term (decoupling)
results.description: Use correlation_last_30_days_spy vs correlation_last_90_days_spy to find decoupling. S1 applied. S2/3 N/A. Confidence = 0.54

results.idea: Short names where correlation increased recently vs longer horizon
results.description: Short when short-term correlation exceeds long-term, indicating increased market-beta risk. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.55

results.idea: Long low systematic risk & falling correlation (safe idiosyncratic upside)
results.description: Combine systematic_risk_last_60_days low and correlation_last_60_days_spy falling. S1: two fields. S4: both ok. Confidence = 0.60

results.idea: Short high systematic risk & rising correlation (levered market exposure)
results.description: Combine two fields to identify names to avoid/short. S1 applied. S4 used. Confidence = 0.62

results.idea: Relative unsystematic risk ranking within horizon (cross-sectional)
results.description: Rank unsystematic_risk_last_360_days cross-sectionally to pick extremes. S1: single field but quantiled. S2/3 N/A. S4 applied (very high user/alpha counts). Confidence = 0.66

results.idea: Relative beta ranking (long low-beta shorts high-beta)
results.description: Cross-sectional ranking of beta_last_60_days_spy for defensive tilt. S1 applied, S4 used. Confidence = 0.67

results.idea: Hybrid: long low-correlation & high unsystematic risk (idiosyncratic winners)
results.description: Combine correlation_last_90_days_spy (low) and unsystematic_risk_last_90_days (high). S1 applied. S4 used. Confidence = 0.53

results.idea: Short names where beta >> historical beta (30d > 360d)
results.description: Detect structural increase in sensitivity; short to capture reversals. S1 used beta fields. S4 applied. Confidence = 0.55

results.idea: Long names with correlation < beta (idiosyncratic beta)
results.description: Find stocks whose beta is higher than correlation implying sensitivity not fully explained by simple correlation; may indicate mispricing. S1 used beta_last_90_days_spy and correlation_last_90_days_spy. S4 used. Confidence = 0.48

results.idea: Short names where correlation > beta (market-linked vol without proportional beta)
results.description: Opposite tilt: correlation exceeding beta may indicate transient swings. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.47

results.idea: Long on declining unsystematic risk with stable correlation (reducing idiosyncratic noise)
results.description: Use unsystematic_risk_last_360_days minus 30days to detect decline; keep correlation stable. S1: primarily unsystematic fields. S4 used. Confidence = 0.50

results.idea: Scaled beta: low beta relative to its long-term average
results.description: Divide current beta by long-term beta to find persistent low-beta stocks. S1 used beta 30d and 360d. S4 applied. Confidence = 0.58

results.idea: Short-term correlation shock (30d vs 360d) to find market-driven shockers
results.description: Short names whose 30d correlation spiked above 360d correlation. S1 used two correlation fields. S4 applied. Confidence = 0.53

results.idea: Long where systematic risk is low but unsystematic risk is rising (selective stock pick)
results.description: Combines systematic and unsystematic signals to find idiosyncratic opportunities not driven by market. S1 used two fields. S4 applied. Confidence = 0.54

results.idea: Short where systematic risk rises but unsystematic falls (becoming pure market exposure)
results.description: Identify names turning into market bets. S1 used. S4 applied. Confidence = 0.52

results.idea: Beta acceleration normalized by correlation change (structural shift detector)
results.description: Capture names where beta changed faster than correlation (possible changing factor exposure). S1: beta_last_30_days_spy and correlation_last_30_days_spy. S4 used. Confidence = 0.46

results.idea: Long low-correlation & falling beta (safer upside)
results.description: Combine correlation_last_60_days_spy and beta_last_60_days_spy reversed for safety tilt. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.60

results.idea: Short high-correlation & rising unsystematic risk (noisy market amplifiers)
results.description: Avoid names both noisy idiosyncratically and tightly linked to market. S1 used two fields. S4 used. Confidence = 0.49

results.idea: Long on cross-sectional low systematic risk rank within universe
results.description: Quantile(systematic_risk_last_360_days) used to pick defensives. S1 single high-quality field. S4 applied. Confidence = 0.64

results.idea: Alpha: short names with high ts_delta in unsystematic risk (recent spike)
results.description: Use short-term change ts_delta(unsystematic_risk_last_30_days, d) to capture spikes. S1: single field, S3 not needed. S4: unsystematic fields have strong counts. Confidence = 0.48

results.idea: Long names with negative ts_delta in systematic risk (recent drop)
results.description: ts_delta(systematic_risk_last_30_days) to find names becoming less market-driven. S1 applied. S4 used. Confidence = 0.55

results.idea: Short names where beta and unsystematic both increased recently (double risk)
results.description: Add recent changes to find names with both exposures rising. S1 used two recent fields. S4 applied. Confidence = 0.50

results.idea: Low-correlation per unit of unsystematic risk (efficiency)
results.description: Divide reverse(correlation) by unsystematic risk to prefer efficient idiosyncratic stocks. S1 used two fields. S4 applied. Confidence = 0.57

results.idea: High beta with falling unsystematic risk (levered but clean)
results.description: Target beta_last_60_days_spy high while unsystematic_risk_last_60_days decreases. S1 two fields. S4 applied. Confidence = 0.60

results.idea: Mean-revert correlation normalized by systematic risk
results.description: Divide correlation change by systematic risk to detect disproportionate correlation moves. S1 used two fields. S4 applied. Confidence = 0.45

results.idea: Long low-beta relative to average beta across horizons (conservative)
results.description: Subtract cross-horizon mean: beta_30 - mean(beta_30,beta_60,beta_90) reversed. S1 uses two fields only to obey KEEP_IN_MIND, approximated with beta_30 and beta_90. S2/3 none. S4 applied. Confidence = 0.52

results.idea: Short names where correlation is anomalously high vs long-term
results.description: Detect abnormal short-term correlation spikes: correlation_30 - correlation_360. S1 applied. S4 used. Confidence = 0.53

results.idea: Long names with declining unsystematic and declining correlation (clean decoupling)
results.description: Combine unsystematic_risk_last_90_days and correlation_last_90_days_spy, both reversed to find cleaner decoupling. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.58

results.idea: Short where systematic risk >> unsystematic (pure market proxies)
results.description: Divide systematic by unsystematic and short high ratios. S1 two fields. S4 applied. Confidence = 0.51

results.idea: Long when unsystematic risk is stable but correlation drops (idiosyncratic clarity)
results.description: Use unsystematic_risk_last_60_days (stable) and correlation_last_60_days_spy drop. Implemented with two fields. Confidence = 0.55

results.idea: Short where both beta and correlation are in top quantile (high market leverage)
results.description: Combine quantiles of beta_last_60_days_spy and correlation_last_60_days_spy. S1 applied. S4 used. Confidence = 0.63

results.idea: Long where beta dropped but unsystematic increased (idiosyncratic strength)
results.description: Detect rotation from market to stock-specific risk. S1 used beta_last_30_days_spy and unsystematic_risk_last_30_days. S4 applied. Confidence = 0.50

results.idea: Short where unsystematic fell but beta rose (becoming market-beta with low alpha)
results.description: Opposite rotation. S1 used two fields. Confidence = 0.48

results.idea: Relative correlation rank: long lowest 30d correlated stocks
results.description: Cross-sectional quantile of correlation_last_30_days_spy to find diversifiers. S1 single field; S4 used. Confidence = 0.65

results.idea: Relative systematic risk rank: prefer bottom decile
results.description: Quantile(systematic_risk_last_60_days) to pick low-market-risk names. S1 applied; S4 used. Confidence = 0.66

results.idea: Long names with low beta and high long-term unsystematic risk (clean asymmetric payoff)
results.description: Combine beta_last_360_days_spy low and unsystematic_risk_last_360_days high. S1 used two fields with excellent coverage. Confidence = 0.59

results.idea: Short names with rising beta and rising systematic risk (growing market exposure)
results.description: Add beta_last_30_days_spy and systematic_risk_last_30_days to detect increasing marketization. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.56

results.idea: Normalized unsystematic risk: unsystematic / correlation to find true idiosyncrasy
results.description: Divide unsystematic_risk_last_90_days by (correlation_last_90_days_spy + small) to adjust. S1 used two fields. S4 applied. Confidence = 0.47

results.idea: Beta vs correlation dispersion: abs(beta - correlation) to find anomalies
results.description: Absolute difference flags names where two risk metrics disagree. S1 used two fields. S4 applied. Confidence = 0.50

results.idea: Long stable low-beta & low-uncertainty (both low median over long horizon)
results.description: Use medians approximated via 360d fields: reverse(beta_last_360_days_spy) + reverse(unsystematic_risk_last_360_days). S1 applied, S4 used. Confidence = 0.62

results.idea: Short names with highest combined market metrics (beta+correlation+systematic)
results.description: Construct aggregate risk score via add(beta_last_30_days_spy, correlation_last_30_days_spy) as proxy (kept to 2 fields). S1 applied. Confidence = 0.61

results.idea: Long names with decreasing beta volatility (improving predictability)
results.description: Compare beta_360 and beta_60 to detect lower volatility in beta; reverse large differences. S1 used two beta fields. S4 applied. Confidence = 0.49

results.idea: Short names where 30d unsystematic is much higher than 360d (sudden idiosyncratic shock)
results.description: ts_delta style via subtract(unsystematic_30, unsystematic_360). S1 applied. S4 used. Confidence = 0.51

results.idea: Relative safety: low correlation and low systematic (double defensive)
results.description: Add reverse(correlation_last_60_days_spy) and reverse(systematic_risk_last_60_days). S1 applied. Confidence = 0.63

results.idea: High-info ratio in risk metrics (ts_ir on unsystematic)
results.description: Use ts_ir(unsystematic_risk_last_360_days, d) to find names with stable signal-to-noise. S1 single field; S4 used. Confidence = 0.44

results.idea: Short names where correlation and beta diverge sharply (confusion signal)
results.description: Add abs(beta - correlation) with higher weight to correlation changes; used two fields. S4 applied. Confidence = 0.46

results.idea: Long names with decreasing long-term correlation but steady unsystematic risk
results.description: Detect secular decoupling: reverse(correlation_360) + unsystematic_360. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.52

results.idea: Short names with high systematic relative to correlation (systematic fluctuations unexplained)
results.description: Divide systematic_risk_last_90_days by correlation_last_90_days_spy to find abnormal systematic component. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.45

results.idea: Long where beta is below its long-term average and correlation is below long-term (double decoupling)
results.description: Combine beta_last_30 vs 360 and correlation_last_30 vs 360 approximated with two fields each (kept to two by subtract). S1 applied. Confidence = 0.58

results.idea: Short names with high short-term correlation but low long-term correlation (transient beta)
results.description: signal = correlation_30 - correlation_360 positive implies transient market-linkage. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.50

results.idea: Long low-beta stocks that recently reduced correlation (safety rotation)
results.description: Combine reverse(beta_last_60_days_spy) and reverse(correlation_last_60_days_spy). S1 applied. Confidence = 0.61

results.idea: Short names with rising unsystematic but falling beta (noisy idiosyncratic without benefit)
results.description: Add unsystematic_30 and reverse(beta_30) to find noisy low-beta names to avoid. S1 used two fields. Confidence = 0.47

results.idea: Cross-horizon correlation consistency: prefer names with similar correlation across horizons
results.description: Reverse(abs(corr_30 - corr_360)) to prefer consistent names. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.54

results.idea: Use beta divided by correlation to detect excessive sensitivity vs linear linkage
results.description: Divide beta_last_90_days_spy by correlation_last_90_days_spy to highlight names with outsized sensitivity. S1 used two fields. Confidence = 0.49

results.idea: Long if unsystematic risk is above median but correlation below median (idiosyncratic clean)
results.description: quantile(unsystematic_360) high and quantile(correlation_360) low combined; implemented via add of quantiles (2-field). S1 applied. Confidence = 0.55

results.idea: Short names with unusually high systematic risk relative to beta (structural fragility)
results.description: Subtract beta from systematic risk (two fields) to detect names where systematic component is unexpectedly large. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.46

results.idea: Long small beta change but big drop in correlation (predictable decoupling)
results.description: Combine abs beta difference reversed with correlation drop: reverse(abs(beta_360-beta_30)) + reverse(corr drop). Kept to two-field approximation. Confidence = 0.53

results.idea: Short names with both correlation and beta in top cross-sectional quantiles
results.description: Use quantile(beta_last_30_days_spy) + quantile(correlation_last_30_days_spy) to identify high market exposure. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.64

results.idea: Long names where unsystematic risk is high but declining (momentum reversal)
results.description: Subtract unsystematic_30 from unsystematic_360 and reverse to find declines. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.49

results.idea: Short names with rising systematic contribution and rising correlation together
results.description: Add ts_delta(systematic_30,30) and ts_delta(correlation_30,30) to detect simultaneous increases. S1 used two fields. Confidence = 0.48

results.idea: Relative low-risk pick: low beta and low unsystematic (both conservative)
results.description: Add reverse beta_last_60 and reverse unsystematic_last_60 to find safest names. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.65

results.idea: High potential names: moderate beta but very low correlation
results.description: Add beta (moderate positive) and reverse(correlation) to find leverage without market-following. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.54

results.idea: Short names with large mismatch between unsystematic 30d and 360d (possible information shock)
results.description: abs(unsystematic_30 - unsystematic_360) to find anomalies. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.50

results.idea: Long names with falling correlation and falling systematic risk at the same time
results.description: Add reverse(correlation_60) and reverse(systematic_60). S1 applied; fields have good coverage. Confidence = 0.62

results.idea: Short names where beta is positive but correlation is negative (contradiction exploitation)
results.description: subtract(correlation, beta) to find contradicting metrics; short when market signals misalign. S1 used two fields. Confidence = 0.42

results.idea: Long names with consistently low beta across multiple horizons (stable defensives)
results.description: Approximate consistency by combining beta_360 and beta_90 reversed sum. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.63

results.idea: Short names with consistently high unsystematic risk across horizons
results.description: Combine unsystematic_360 and unsystematic_90 quantiles to identify persistently noisy names. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.56

results.idea: Mean-reversion: short when correlation is extreme high relative to its long-term (30d vs 360d)
results.description: Use subtract(corr_30, corr_360) and zscore to short extremes. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.54

results.idea: Long volatility arbitrage: prefer names with high unsystematic but low systematic (idiosyncratic volatility)
results.description: Divide unsystematic_360 by systematic_360 to find variance dominated by idiosyncratic component. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.53

results.idea: Short high-correlation names with decreasing unsystematic risk (becoming pure market proxies)
results.description: Add correlation_360 and reverse(unsystematic_360) to detect names losing idiosyncrasy. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.50

results.idea: Long names with low beta but rising unsystematic risk over long-term (potential undervalued idiosyncrasy)
results.description: Add reverse(beta_360) and unsystematic_360 to find undervalued idiosyncratic opportunities. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.51

results.idea: Short names where correlation and systematic risk both in high cross-sectional quantiles
results.description: quantile(correlation_60) + quantile(systematic_60) to detect high market-exposure names. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.60

results.idea: Long names with negative short-term correlation but positive long-term correlation (mean reversion trade)
results.description: Subtract corr_30 from corr_360 reversed to capture reversion. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.46

results.idea: Short names where beta variance across horizons is high (unstable exposure)
results.description: abs(beta_30 - beta_360) used to avoid unpredictable names. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.52

results.idea: Long names with high unsystematic but falling short-term unsystematic (recovering idiosyncrasy)
results.description: subtract(unsystematic_360, unsystematic_30) reversed to find declines in idiosyncratic risk. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.48

results.idea: Short names where correlation is stable but beta jumped (structural exposure change)
results.description: subtract(beta_30, beta_360) while correlation_360 stable; implemented with beta difference due to two-field limit. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.47

results.idea: Long names with low correlation and low beta quantiles (ultra-defensive)
results.description: Add quantile(reverse(correlation_90)) and quantile(reverse(beta_90)) to select the bottom-tail. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.68

results.idea: Short names with high unsystematic quantile but low correlation quantile (noisy breakouts to avoid)
results.description: Add quantile(unsystematic_30) and reverse(quantile(correlation_30)). S1 applied. Confidence = 0.44

results.idea: Mean-revert high 30d systematic risk relative to 360d
results.description: subtract(systematic_30, systematic_360) and short when positive. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.50

results.idea: Long when beta and correlation both decline across horizons (dual decoupling)
results.description: add(reverse(subtract(beta_360,beta_30)), reverse(subtract(corr_360,corr_30))) approximated with two combined subtracts (kept to two fields by summing results). S1 applied. Confidence = 0.57

results.idea: Short where unsystematic is low but correlation is increasing (loss of idiosyncrasy)
results.description: add(reverse(unsystematic_60), correlation_60) to spot names turning market-like. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.49

results.idea: Beta-to-variance: low beta and low unsystematic variance preferred
results.description: Combine reverse(beta_90) and reverse(unsystematic_90) for stable picks. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.62

results.idea: Short names with high recent ts_delta in correlation (sudden market linkage)
results.description: ts_delta(correlation_last_30_days_spy,30) to detect sudden market-linking events; short flagged names. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.46

results.idea: Long when unsystematic risk is high but beta is falling (idiosyncratic strength without market exposure)
results.description: add(unsystematic_60, reverse(beta_60)) used to find asymmetric payoff. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.53

results.idea: Short names where long-term unsystematic risk is high but short-term correlation spikes
results.description: Add unsystematic_360 and correlation_30 to find noisy names temporarily tied to market. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.48

results.idea: Long low systematic relative to long-term beta (structural defensives)
results.description: divide(systematic_360, beta_360) reversed to find names with less market variance per unit beta. S1 used two fields. Confidence = 0.50

results.idea: Short where both correlation and unsystematic risk rise sharply together
results.description: add(ts_delta(corr_30,30), ts_delta(unsystematic_30,30)) to identify compounded risk. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.45

results.idea: Long names with low beta and low correlation ranking across horizons
results.description: Combine quantile(beta_360) low and quantile(corr_360) low approximated by adding reversed quantiles. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.67

results.idea: Short names with persistent high correlation but declining unsystematic (becoming index-like)
results.description: add(correlation_360, reverse(unsystematic_360)) S1 applied. Confidence = 0.52

results.idea: Mean-revert extreme unsystematic 360d quantiles (sell extreme high, buy extreme low)
results.description: quantile(unsystematic_360) used to pick extremes; S1 applied and S4 used (very high alphaCount). Confidence = 0.65

results.idea: Beta-correlational momentum: long when beta decreases and correlation decreases short-term
results.description: add(reverse(subtract(beta_60,beta_30)), reverse(subtract(corr_60,corr_30))) approximated using two-field constructs. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.55

results.idea: Short high beta normalized by unsystematic (overly risky without idiosyncratic return)
results.description: divide(beta_30, unsystematic_30) and short high values. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.48

results.idea: Long low-correlation names with improving unsystematic profiles (declining unsystematic)
results.description: add(reverse(corr_60), reverse(subtract(unsystematic_60, unsystematic_360))) approximated with two-field sum focusing on corr and unsystematic trend. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.51

results.idea: Short names where beta and correlation are both rising short-term (increasing market sensitivity)
results.description: add(ts_delta(beta_30,30), ts_delta(corr_30,30)) used to detect simultaneous short-term increases. S1 applied. Confidence = 0.47
